content:
Elsewhere @Joe Moeller wrote:

Wow! The last time I went to the AMS Western sectional meeting, there was a session on quantum algebra, and one on tensor categorical methods in rep theory. This time, there's:

Western:

  • Algebraic and Combinatorial Aspects of Polytopes
  • Categorical and Combinatorial Methods in Representation Theory
  • Connections Between Homotopical Algebra and Geometry
  • Diagrammatic and Combinatorial Methods in Representation Theory
  • Geometric and Categorical Methods in Representation Theory
  • Quivers, Tensors, and Their Applications

Southeastern:

  • Tropical Geometry, F1\mathbb F_1F1â€‹-connections, and Matroids

Eastern:

  • Hopf Algebras, Tensor Categories, and Related Homological Methods
Right now the Southeastern and Eastern ones have talks scheduled already, while the Western one does not yet.
I'm very excited for these. To be clear, I only listed the specific ones that interested me. There are many other sessions scheduled.

John Baez said:

  • Categorical and Combinatorial Methods in Representation Theory
  • Diagrammatic and Combinatorial Methods in Representation Theory

What's the major difference between these two, do you think?
Probably just different speakers. I imagine there's going to be lots of people jumping back and forth between these and the others. I will be.
You could offer to give a talk in the former of these two sessions if it's not too late, Joe. I guess it's too late.
But anyway, you can keep your eye out for AMS special sessions where it makes sense to give a talk about Schur functors. (I guess you're doing that?)
Right, a lot of these would be good for that.
